channel.title: Comments on: Neat Receipts Keeps Me On Top Of My Receipts

item.title: By: Russell Heimlich
item.dc:creator: Russell Heimlich
item.description: Beats me. I don't export my receipts to a Doc. Exporting to PDFs works fine.
item.content:encoded: Beats me. I don’t export my receipts to a Doc. Exporting to PDFs works fine.

item.title: By: Rick H
item.dc:creator: Rick H
item.description:
I too realy like the software.
I am thought seeing issues converting a Doc. to receipts.. once converted you can't read the conversion to the receipt. Though... when first scanned as a doc one can read it fine..
Any thoughts... done all the cleaning steps required...
Thank you.. :)
item.content:encoded:
I too realy like the software.

I am thought seeing issues converting a Doc. to receipts.. once converted you can’t read the conversion to the receipt. Though… when first scanned as a doc one can read it fine..

Any thoughts… done all the cleaning steps required…

Thank you..

item.title: By: Chrisb
item.dc:creator: Chrisb
item.description: Thank you for responding. I just bought it and trying to get organized. I love that I can easily search and find my receipts.
item.content:encoded: Thank you for responding. I just bought it and trying to get organized. I love that I can easily search and find my receipts.

item.title: By: Russell Heimlich
item.dc:creator: Russell Heimlich
item.description: All of the documents are stored in NeatReceipts. You have to specifically export them to use them in another application.
item.content:encoded: All of the documents are stored in NeatReceipts. You have to specifically export them to use them in another application.

item.title: By: Chrisb
item.dc:creator: Chrisb
item.description: I thought when I scan the documents, they will be saved on my computer and I can then transfer them to say external hard drive or the cloud. I am confused. Where are the scans? I can only see then when I use the application.
item.content:encoded:
I thought when I scan the documents, they will be saved on my computer and I can then transfer them to say external hard drive or the cloud. I am confused.
Where are the scans? I can only see then when I use the application.

item.title: By: My Stats From 2011 » Random Musings » Russell Heimlich
item.dc:creator: My Stats From 2011 » Random Musings » Russell Heimlich
item.description: [...] unique visitors generating 213,800 pageviews. Not bad considering I hardly update it anymore.I scanned 454 receipts and spent at least $346.96 in sales tax.Kristina and I fully funded our IRAs (including starting [...]
item.content:encoded: […] unique visitors generating 213,800 pageviews. Not bad considering I hardly update it anymore.I scanned 454 receipts and spent at least $346.96 in sales tax.Kristina and I fully funded our IRAs (including starting […]

item.title: By: Joan Lowder
item.dc:creator: Joan Lowder
item.description:
I also love my scanner. Actually haven't thought of standing mine up and putting it to sleep with it's cover. Mine sits on my desk all the time but since I don't really use it daily I guess I could store it. Issue I'm having is that I can't get it to back up now. All that time backing up and then I got an error message. Suggestions? No response from N/R yet. I've downloaded the revised version.
Yes on the above. My plan was to move the scanner from computer to computer but finally decided to just use one computer since then the backup would be in one place.
item.content:encoded:
I also love my scanner. Actually haven’t thought of standing mine up and putting it to sleep with it’s cover. Mine sits on my desk all the time but since I don’t really use it daily I guess I could store it. Issue I’m having is that I can’t get it to back up now. All that time backing up and then I got an error message. Suggestions? No response from N/R yet. I’ve downloaded the revised version.

Yes on the above. My plan was to move the scanner from computer to computer but finally decided to just use one computer since then the backup would be in one place.

item.title: By: Russell Heimlich
item.dc:creator: Russell Heimlich
item.description: Couldn't you just install the Neat Receipts scanner software on both machines and then just move the scanner from each one anytime you need to do a scan?
item.content:encoded: Couldn’t you just install the Neat Receipts scanner software on both machines and then just move the scanner from each one anytime you need to do a scan?

item.title: By: Jean
item.dc:creator: Jean
item.description: I bought the Neat Receipts about 1 year ago. My husband installed it on his computer and I need it on mine. He uses it for receipts, I want to use it for documenting the networking business cards that I collect. Do you know where I can get whatever I need to be able to make the scanner portable to use on both our computers? I use VISTA. We have had no luck finding it on our own. Can I do an upgrade and just pay the company a bit more to use it on two computers? Any help is appreciated. j.
item.content:encoded:
I bought the Neat Receipts about 1 year ago. My husband installed it on his computer and I need it on mine. He uses it for receipts, I want to use it for documenting the networking business cards that I collect. Do you know where I can get whatever I need to be able to make the scanner portable to use on both our computers? I use VISTA. We have had no luck finding it on our own. Can I do an upgrade and just pay the company a bit more to use it on two computers?
Any help is appreciated.
j.

item.title: By: Russell Heimlich
item.dc:creator: Russell Heimlich
item.description:
A+B) Does the IRS accept digital receipts?
Yes. According to ruling Rev. Proc. 97-22, the IRS allows one to prepare, record, transfer, index, store, preserve, retrieve, and reproduce books and records by either electronically imaging hard copy documents to an electronic storage media, or transferring computerized books and records to an electronic storage media that allows them to be viewed or reproduced without using the original program.
source: http://www.neatco.com/products/common-questions#Taxes
C) For scanning receipts, it's way less than 1 minute per receipt. It isn't automatic as you have to manually feed the receipts into the scanner and press a button. It's designed for people with few receipts they need to store.
item.content:encoded:
A+B) Does the IRS accept digital receipts?

Yes. According to ruling Rev. Proc. 97-22, the IRS allows one to prepare, record, transfer, index, store, preserve, retrieve, and reproduce books and records by either electronically imaging hard copy documents to an electronic storage media, or transferring computerized books and records to an electronic storage media that allows them to be viewed or reproduced without using the original program.

source: http://www.neatco.com/products.....ions#Taxes

C) For scanning receipts, it’s way less than 1 minute per receipt. It isn’t automatic as you have to manually feed the receipts into the scanner and press a button. It’s designed for people with few receipts they need to store.
